snippet.title: COVID healthcare system crumbling, Nightmare for the patients? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the COVID-19 pandemic and its impact on the Indian health facilities were discussed. The ground reality comes as shocking news with the way India has been dealing with the Covid-19 pandemic. The governments are now being questioned the way they maintained their crumbling healthcare system of the country. One of the incidents that came was how an elderly woman who tested positive for COVID-19 was seen crying in agony, helplessly waiting for treatment at the gate of a government hospital in Jalgaon.

This hospital came in the news as an 82-year-old woman was found dead in the toilet. Another such incident that was highlighted from Jalgaon was when a mother kept waiting for 6 hours for an ICU bed, says a resident from Jalgaon who lost his mother to COVID-19. His grandmother was admitted to the same hospital and went missing from the ward. Her body was then found in the hospital toilet after 8 days. 

A journalist named Manoj was tested positive for COVID and was admitted to Hyderabad's Gandhi Hospital. His brother says that he had to fight with doctors to move him to ICU but there was a delay because there were no oxygen cylinders. Manoj died of a cardiac arrest on June 7.

snippet.title: Kejriwal under house arrest; Was AAP Sarkar's claim against Delhi police genuine? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through all the details of Bharat Band which was called in by the protesting farmers today. Even though many States pledged to follow the shutdown call, a limited impact of Bharat Bandh was witnessed across the country.
According to the latest update, a sixth-round of talks between the Centre and Kisan Leaders will be held tomorrow over the controversial Farm Laws. Ahead of this meeting, Union Home Minister Amit Shah had called in another meeting with the farmers’ leaders.
Meanwhile, AAP Government has claimed that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal had been put under house arrest by the Delhi Police and no one was allowed to enter his residence. However, the Delhi Police denied all the allegations exposing several proofs. After hours of the faceoff between the Delhi Police and AAP workers over the alleged house arrest of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, the AAP workers were finally allowed to enter his residence.

Watch!

snippet.title: 85 days after Sushant Singh Rajput's death; What is the status of the ED probe? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, after 85 days since Sushant Singh Rajput's death, there are various leads to the case that are probing the drug link and the financial angle. Three investigation agencies and a million theories are out in the open, but hyperventilating hysteria does not get justice?

Tanvi Shukla looks at the probe so far and breaks down all the facts on record. The Enforcement Directorate is looking to the money laundering aspect in the case. The Enforcement Directorate started its probe before the CBI. So what is the status of the probe by the Enforcement Directorate?

Narcotics Control Bureau is the only agency that has made arrests in the case so far. Dr. NC Asthana, Former DGP, says that the channels reporting in such a vociferous manner, they have been violating the Supreme Court orders and tormenting the poor girl. Senior Supreme Court Advocate, Kailash Vasdev explains what happens to cases when there are so many leaks, theories, public conversations, and media trials.

snippet.title: Is the Nitish govt not taking encephalitis outbreak seriously? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza, Over 100 children die in Bihar due to Encephalitis in 16 days. Bihar is facing one of it's worst encephalitis outbreaks this year. From the Nitish government, MoS Health Ashwini Choubey was spotted yawning and allegedly ‘snoozing’ at the same meeting. Choubey could be seen sitting with his eyes closed even as Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan spoke at the meet, according to the video and the Bihar health minister appeared to have the cricket on his mind even as he sat down for the meeting along with Union Minister of Health Harsh Vardhan and MoS health Ashwini Choubey.

Mirror Now asks- Was the Nitish Government unprepared for the outbreak? Are they not taking it seriously? Was the government distracted by the Lok Sabha elections? Is the Nitish government not taking encephalitis outbreak seriously? Why is the cricket score more important at a meeting about the deaths of children due to Encephalitis than finding a solution for it? Why is healthcare so poorly paid attention to & so low on our priority in our country? How many more children have to die before the right action is taken?

snippet.title: Sushant Singh death probe: Top conspiracy theories busted | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the status of the Sushant Singh Rajput case. A hundred and fourteen days later, and after the AIIMS report, we discuss the five big facts on Sushant Singh Rajput probe. 

The AIIMS report has repudiated the murder conspiracy and ruled it out as suicide. Satish Maneshinde, Rhea Chakraborty’s lawyer has stated that the Mumbai Police had also reached a conclusion after the Cooper Hospital’s toxicology report that there was no foul play involved. He went ahead to say, “I would beseech all those who are jumping to conclusions, to come to rest & wait for the CBI to make a declaration and file a report before the Court of law”. 

Sanjay Hegde, a senior Supreme Court Advocate, commented on the entire case by stating, “Sushant Singh Rajput had had a history of mental illness, there were fights over his treatment, things had not gone well at that stage in his career. He committed suicide. It has been blown up. The drama must now end”. 

Geeta Luthra, Senior Advocate Supreme Court, on the other hand, states that “The fact that Rhea Chakraborty was not with Sushant Singh Rajput for the last 4-5 days, in its own way takes away the theory of abetment to suicide”. 

MN Singh, Former Commissioner of Police, Mumbai expresses his dejection over the case. He states, “It is very unfortunate that while the case was being investigated, the media made all kinds of insinuations against various types of people and created a campaign to malign the Mumbai Police.” 
#SushantSinghRajput #RheaChakraborty

snippet.title: Will 2019 Lok Sabha polls hit states fortunes? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate With Faye D'Sozua, exit polls spoke the opposition. A confident BJP is blamed of reigniting operation 'Kamla 2.0.' Political pundits believe post-May 23rd, the NDA's first targets would be Madhya Pradesh & Karnataka governments. Also in Madhya Pradesh, they have made their first move.
The Bharatiya Janata Party dared M.P CM Kamal Nath to do a floor test to prove the Congress' majority. Kamal Nath has claimed that more than 10 of his ministers are receiving calls with offers for cabinet seats.
Whereas in Karnataka cracks seem to be emerging the Congress party. Senior Congress leader Roshan Baig sparked a fresh controversy by alleging that the Congress party sold ministerial berths.
If the NDA does sweep & like polls suggest, BJP wins 15-19 seats, will the Karnataka Govt be in trouble?
Do you think that your MLAs are strong within your government and they won't accept any offers from the other side?

snippet.title: How should India tackle the education crisis caused by COVID-19 pandemic? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, find out if the decision of the CBSE and ICSE boards to cancel exams amid COVID case surge is in favour of the students. Uncertainty surrounds the student community as they wonder if the schedule for competitive exams for higher students will also be changed. 

There has also been significant reservation on the decision to evaluate and promote students based on previous scores and internal assessment.

“If we plan to go by the internal assessment, our internal assessment are not that good, we tend to work harder for the boards,” says, Arya Sethi, 12th Grade CBSE Student 

There has been widespread questioning on CBSE offering give ‘exams later’ to students as an option. 

“I think leaving the entire internal assessment as the basis of admission for colleges, opens a whole new set of problems. What is the sanctity of the scores that’ll get submitted?” Says, Aakash Chaudhry, Director and CEO, Aakash Educational Services Limited 

The decision to cancel exams has been long drawn and full of ambiguities which add to the pain of both students as well as worried parents. 

#BoardExamMess 

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: Is no exam stand amid COVID crisis genuine fear or a politicized statement? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the question of examinations amid the Coronavirus pandemic was being discussed. Dr. Mungekar, Former Rajya Sabha MP, Congress, Former VC, Mumbai University questions if there is a legitimate fear about holding examinations in the current scenario or can it be done and everything else is just politics?

Akshay Marathe, AAP explains how he took an online examination and he assures that if he did not have a laptop, a quiet room, and speedy WiFi connection, it would have been impossible to take the examination, he then states that a large majority of the country does not have access to these amenities. He further questions the central governments over why they are holding the future of the students to ransom.

Professor MM Ansari, Former Member, UGC, states that a large number of universities have conducted examinations or are in the process of conducting examinations, whereas others have expressed their inability due to the COVID threat.

snippet.title: Should Supreme Court take severe actions against Delhi government for pollution? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Delhi government’s ignorance as the pollution spikes again. The government’s lack of efforts for the same despite Supreme Court issuing over hundred orders raises the question of whether the SC should take actions against the officials involved? 
Years after facing the same problem and seeing no improvement in the matter, we discuss how can we fix the problem. 
A petitioner, Aditya Dubey, states that the main cause of pollution in Delhi is stubble burning. He goes on to say that even after years of facing the same problem, the government has not done anything. Covid-19 crisis will further aggravate and something has to be done otherwise many might die. 
To this, BJP spokesperson, Raman Malik says, "Environment Minister has stated that 95% of pollution in Delhi comes from Delhi itself & 5% comes from stubble burning. It is one of the many reasons.”

#DelhiPollution #DelhiChokes

snippet.title: SC on Right to Protest in Shaheen Bagh; How will it impact the future protests? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, amidst the various debates, the Shaheen Bagh case has now come forward with a lot of many revelations. Supreme Court's verdict on Shaheen Bagh protests that are held in the public domain is the most questionable debate. 

Shaheen Bagh emerged as the centre of CAA-NRC protests during December 2019. Not only was it recognized nationally but internationally too. Anjali Bhardwaj, a social activist states that the court has upheld the right to protest. 

She further affs that it has said that protests should be in designated spaces. Unfortunately, there has been a huge shrinking of space where people can come out and put forth their points of view. 

Sudesh, a BJP spokesperson explains that there is a way by which one can disown the government, he further explains that one can mobilise public opinion. 

When elections come, one can throw out the government, but one cannot say what they are doing is correct and what the other party is doing is wrong.

'Social issues are the remedy and cause of the protest and administrative issues ensure that the larger citizenry is not impacted. Both have to go hand in hand,' says Sidharth Luthra, Former Additional Solicitor General.

snippet.title: Supreme Court on loan moratorium; Should relief for repaying EMIs be extended? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Afrida Rahman Ali, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman held a meeting with the heads of banks & NBFCs to review the implementation of one-time debt recast for resolution of COVID-19 related stress in bank loans. Finance Minister urged them to lend actively during the upcoming festive season.

Supreme Court heard a batch of petitions seeking an interest waiver on loan moratorium. Afrida Rahman Ali shares all the updates on what was observed in the court. 

If there is no interest waiver, what do borrowers get in terms of relief? Afrida Rahman Ali questions MSME India President  Mukesh Mohan Gupta. 

BJP spokeperson Vishwas Pathak says "This government is open to relaxations for specific cases. However, it can't be blanket. If you're an honest borrower with a good track record, this moratorium period can go even up to 2-years."


Watch!

snippet.title: 5 lakh people die due to lack of organ donors; How can citizens help? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, as India celebrates the Organ Donation Day, it is reported that around 5 lakh lives are lost in India due to the unavailability of organs. This Organ Donation Day, we discuss how we can help save lives. Dr. Vasanthi Ramesh, Director of National Organ and Tissue Transplant Organization explains why it is important for every Indian to be part of the organ donation program. 

All the myths need to be busted, there has to be an institutionalised mechanism and hospitals and NGOs need to work together, says, R Sundaram, Senior Journalist. Brajesh Kunwar, Senior and Chief Interventional Cardiologist, says that India needs to have dedicated hospitals to transplant, then only we can have good results.

Counseling is very important and that is why people need to be trained in order to counsel well as the prime purpose for a doctor is to save lives, says, Sr. Pranaw Jha, Senior Consultation Nephrologist.

snippet.title: Is the move to freeze Amnesty’s account, a witch hunt or valid crackdown? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes up the latest topic of the day which has gathered attention from everyone alike today. Amnesty International India has decided to halt all its operations in India, after the Centre froze their bank accounts. Amnesty International is a human rights Non-governmental organization, based out of the United Kingdom. The organization has been accused of receiving funds illegally and thus the government has frozen its accounts, under the Foreign Exchange Management Act violations.

While the Amnesty calls it a ‘witch-hunt’ by the Central government, the Ministry of Home Affairs has issued a statement and clarified that this is not a witch hunt but simply the rule of law which has to be followed by every organization. Problems have arisen for those organizations which have received foreign funding, especially during the NDA government’s rule in the country. To discuss and debate about the same, the panel on today’s Urban Debate includes BJP spokesperson Shweta Shalini, Suhas Chakma, Director at Rights and Risks Analysis Group and Gautam Mukherjee, Senior Journalist. 

Shweta Shalini states that ‘foreign funds are allowed in every organization, including NGOs, through a legal way.’ Amnesty under the garb of NGO was earning profits and doing anti-national activities. To contradict this, Suhas Chakma states that we have a situation where political parties, that run the country, can receive foreign funds, but NGOs are subjected to investigations.

snippet.title: Top honey brands accused of adulteration; How safe is food in India? I The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate tonight, Tanvi Shukla discusses the adulteration of honey that has been claimed by Delhi based advocacy group, Centre for Science and Environment (CSE) on Wednesday. CSE has claimed that 77 percent of samples from India's top honey brands were found to use the modified syrup in their honey to clear the safety tests. Only 3 of the 13 brands which include, Saffola, Markfed Sohna, and Nature’s Nectar were able to clear the Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (NMR) tests. Even brands like Dabur and Patanjali have not cleared the test according to the allegation. FSSAI is yet to respond to this allegation. Can India not even trust the big brands?

snippet.title: Ram Mandir's Bhoomi Pujan sparks controversies, is the criticism warranted? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through the latest updates on the foundation laying ceremony of Ram Temple in Ayodhya, illustrating various major controversies that emerged and came along with this mega event.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi had stated in his address that ‘India has scripted history and Ram is for all’. However, while entire India is engrossed in chanting the name of Lord Ram, there are others who have lashed out at the Government for conducting the Bhoomi Pujan.

‘Artificially manufactured controversy is being provoked towards Hindus & incites Muslims. All this is contempt of court’ says, RSS Supporter, Desh Ratan Nigam. Whereas, Neerja Chowdhury, Senior Journalist questions ‘The Supreme Court gave its verdict & it seems like the Muslim community has accepted it, just like they had said. Court also talked about 1992 demolition being a criminal act; then shouldn't you hold those responsible for it, culpable in some way?’

WATCH!

Whereas, Neerja Chowdhury, Senior Journalist questions ‘The Supreme Court gave its verdict & it seems like the Muslim community has accepted it, just like they had said. Court also talked about 1992 demolition being a criminal act; then shouldn't you hold those responsible for it, culpable in some way?’

WATCH!

snippet.title: Haryana allows 75% job reservation for locals; Is job quota promise just rhetoric? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about a call taken by the Haryana Government for providing reservation quota for the Haryanvi locals. Haryana assembly has passed a bill to provide 75% reservations in the private sector to locals who are seeking jobs in the state.

However, the bill provides a quota for local people in private-sector jobs that provide a salary of less than ₹50,000 per month. Experts are saying that this isn't very attractive for the industries. So, what's the point of bringing such a law, where you promise jobs, but there won't be new jobs coming in? Is jobs quota promise by states just rhetoric?

#Reservation #QuotaBill #Haryana

snippet.title: Was Bengaluru's brutal mob attack a planned conspiracy? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Bengaluru riots that have disrupted the peace of the city were being discussed. Bengaluru is now fighting COVID-19 and the brutal vandalism over a social media post.

We always speak about taking the strictest possible actions against the agitators, but if someone takes the law into their hands, certainly they need to be punished for it, says, Brijesg Kalappa, Karnataka Congress. 

Vivel S Reddy, BJP Karnataka says that the government will be initiating a law to seize the properties of the offenders and they will be brought to book. TR Prasad Gowda states that it was Akhanda Srinivasa Murthy's residence where the protest was organized by the Muslim youth. He says that the vibrations of the protest were such that anyone could predict it would go to a bad extent.

snippet.title: Fuel price hike adds to recession woes; Will the governments provide relief? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the hike in the prices of fuel. The prices of petrol and diesel have increased for the sixth day in a row. The fuel prices are at an all-time 2-year high, further adding to the recession woes. The fuel prices have raised 15 times since November 20. The price of petrol in Delhi stands at Rs 83.71, in Mumbai, it's beyond Rs 90/liter. Diesel too has gone up to Rs 80.5/liter now. Should the Central and state governments step in and provide the much-needed relief to the common man? Furthermore, can the government afford to give relief, given that the economy is in recession?

Tanvi Shukla discusses this with the panelists, which includes Anshul Avijit, Prof Aman Agarwal, and Viswas Pathak.

snippet.title: Kerala activist Rehana Fathima moves to SC, Is nudity necessarily obscene? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, the debate over nudity and obscenity was being discussed, Activist Rehana Fathima was booked for a video that showed her minor children paining on her semi-nude body. The case has moved to the Supreme Court, saying that nudity is not necessarily obscenity. 

If people really want to raise a point, they should go to Bollywood and book everyone who objectifies women, as women are often objectified there, says Yogita Bhayana on the row over video of Rehana's children painting her body. She also says that she does not believe that Rehana was objectifying herself in the video.

CPI leader Annie Raja states that the core issue is that is a woman's body is being viewed as a sexual object. Even the court seems uncomfortable about a woman's body. She further states that nobody forced people to watch the video, it is about personal choice.

snippet.title: Has Sushant Singh Rajput's Death Case turned into an ego battle for cops? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla explains the entire issue revolving around Sushant Singh Rajput and Disha Salian’s death case investigation. Now, the case is slightly turning into an ego battle between the Bihar and Mumbai police, especially after the Supreme Court’s hearing.

The Apex Court has raised a question on quarantining Patna SP Vinay Tiwari, while Bihar police claim that it is a virtual house arrest, Mumbai Police, on the other hand, denies the allegation saying that is a mandatory move with respect to COVID-19

Why should the two police department be locking horns like this? Is it high time for the police & government now to step back and let CBI investigate?

‘Unprofessional conduct has been displayed by both Mumbai & Bihar Police. If the police were really autonomous & professional, the Sushant Singh Rajput case could have been solved in 5 days’ says Former IPS Officer, Yashovardhan Azad. While, Advocate Geeta Luthra state, ‘Question is that can a person who doesn’t have jurisdiction, transfer the matter to Centre. The law envisages that to get CBI to enquire, the state police should agree. In this case, Maharashtra is the jurisdictional Police & they've not agreed’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: Should India legalize the use of Cannabis? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about the recent decision that the United Nations has made. United Nations has today has legalized various products of cannabis including Marijuana. The United Nations has added that cannabis is not dangerous. India along with the majority voted to remove cannabis from the list of the most dangerous substances. Cannabis was listed along with deadly opioids. As of now, cannabis is illegal in India. Should India take the move to legalize cannabis?

Tanvi Shukla takes this across to the panelists on the show which includes, Dr. Shyam Aggarwal, BV Kumar, Dr. Atul, Vikram Patel, and Tathagata Satpathy.

snippet.title: What does the Bihar verdict means for national politics? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Today we are putting the spotlight on Bihar election verdict. At the end of a dramatic counting day that was as exciting as Tuesday's IPL final, Bihar’s final verdict of the Assembly election arrived well past midnight. Proving most exit polls wrong, the ruling NDA crossed the mid-way mark in the 243-member Bihar Assembly, winning 125 seats.

Mirror Now questions BJP's Guru Prakash Paswan, asks "Has the coalition dharma's definition changed? Is it now about destroying coalitions? I don't see any ally left except Janata Dal (United) and Dr Ramdas Athawale."

RSS Supporter Dr Nigam says that BJP believes in inclusive politics. But if you want to confront BJP in the election, you will have to be careful because then they will destroy you.

#BiharElectionResults2020

snippet.title: Should regulations be placed on 'Digital media' platforms? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Once something is uploaded on Social Media, it circulates & gets viral very quickly. There perhaps needs to be regulations and that's the government's order. What should be the rules and regulations for digital media, a new age media for all kinds of professions?

Supreme Court Senior Advocate Sanjay Hegde says "Under the IT Act, you can take out specific content. You cannot regulate it, you can do regular policing. The affidavit, in this case, is being slightly economical with the truth when it's saying there is no regulation & SC must step in to regulate."

Watch!

snippet.title: Will the sudden rise in child marriages continue post lockdown? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the hidden impact of Coronavirus pandemic and lockdown. 
With Coronavirus disrupting the per diem lives of everybody including major economies it has also wreaked havoc in the lives of many children. Child marriages in Maharashtra have increased by 78.3% till September. 138 cases have been reported in the last three months. Women and Child Development Ministry have stopped 120 child marriages whilst the local authorities are also working on the same. 
Poverty and financial instability has driven many families to marry their young daughters off. This year’s figure has witnessed a steepest rise compared to the last five years. 
Isidore Phillips, Director of Divya Disha commented on the issue. He stated that the biggest problem in child protection is that if we do not acknowledge that child marriages are happening, we will not be able to work towards resolving it. He emphasised that we need to first start by acknowledging that there’s a problem. 
Charu Pragya, Spokesperson for BJP stated that whether it’s health, education or employment, girls have lost out on all these because of Covid-19 pandemic. To tackle this, she said, we need to ensure that prevention of Child Marriage Act is a secular act, spread awareness by education not only for parents but girls too. 

#ChildMarriages #Maharashtra

snippet.title: Should vaccine distribution be used as an election campaign promise? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla demonstrates a controversy which has been stirred a few days ahead of Bihar Elections. The Bhartiya Janata Party released a manifesto for Bihar Poll was certain promises were made to the people. One of their main promises was distributing free COVID-19 vaccines in Bihar, but only if they got elected.

This free vaccine distribution promise irked the opposition parties, which resulted in numerous slandering remarks. Some parties even termed promise as a bribe for voters.

But, should vaccine distribution be used as an election campaign promise? If Free Vaccine is the need, shouldn't it be extended to all states? In a diverse income country, should vaccine be made free for all?

On one hand, RJD’s Syed Faisal Ali says ‘The BJP is trying to fool the voters of #Bihar. This is a desperate attempt to regain their lost ground: RJD's Syed Faisal Ali’.

While on another hand Congress; Dr Shama says ‘The EC should take strict note of this. It is kind of a threat. Secondly, the vaccination is on a trial stage so isn't this a false promise? And why free vaccine only for Bihar? This shows that this is an election gimmick’

Watch!

#BiharElection2020 #BiharPoll #BJPBihar

snippet.title: What is a priority of Government, Elections or human life?  | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about the bridge which collapsed in CSMT. What can be the reason for this massacre?
Everyone is blaming each other, but no victim has been named.
Why has no government official been named for the Mumbai bridge collapse? 
What does 'Bhrashtachar Mukt Bharat' mean.
Can the Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis assure us that the city of Mumbai & all the bridges, Safe? 
So, if they are going to sit here and blame each other, we would be fools to fall for it: 
The government has not convicted anyone. Nobody has gone to jail earlier also, these are just lip-service.
Why is Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis in Amravati and not in Mumbai? And at what point will Municipal Commissioner, Ajoy Mehta be sacked? 


Mumbai bridge collapsed because of corruption. They could've cleared the projects to fix those bridges but instead, they cleared the projects that will make them money. 
You & I don't matter, and we've to remember that when we go to the polls. 
Election Campaigns or Human Lives. What's the priority? 
Listen in!

snippet.title: What role is India playing in the development of the Coronavirus vaccine? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, We all know that the progression of COVID-19 disease is unpredictable. Some cases stay mild, some face severe sickness that necessitates hospitalization and even oxygen/ventilatory support. Tonight we put the spotlight again on something that the whole world is waiting for and that's the vaccine for Coronavirus. When will Covid vaccines be ready? Can India afford huge cost of vaccines? Does India have the required storage facilities? What are the challenges related to distribution and disbursal? 

Senior Journalist Vikas Dandekar says, "While it is encouraging that all of these vaccines are found to be more than 90% effective in their interim analysis, we need to remember that these are all going through very fastrack plans." 

#CovidVaccine

snippet.title: Fuel prices continue to rise, Will aam aadmi get respite? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, find out how the decision of the government to hike fuel prices 18-days in a row affects the Aam Aadmi buried under the pressures of a pandemic. Is there a middle ground where the government  earns but the common man doesn’t bear the full burden? 

“What are the other ways of raising funds of taxation than this method?” explains, Saurabh Chandra, Former Secretary, Petroleum Ministry

The opposition has questioned the Centre’s asking about the funds it has collected during its term and how it plans to continue this hike if people are unhappy. 

“We should get Petrol & Diesel under VAT. Over 120 lakh crore money that GOI had collected in last 6-years by increasing prices of fuel, where's that money being used, if that's not being utilised during an emergency?” Says, Radhika Khera, Congress Spokesperson 

There has been a call to action in India as the debate rages on however, the central issue remains the need to find a better solution that serves as a compromise between the people and the administration. 

#FuelPricesHiked



Watch!

snippet.title: Key witness shot dead, Is state trying to shield riot accused? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
A prime example of the lack of fear of law in Uttar Pradesh came to light today when a milkman, who was a prime witness to the brutal murder of his two brothers during the Muzaffarnagar riots, was shot dead by armed assailants in broad daylight. The victim, Ashbab who worked as a milk vendor was murdered in his native village of Khatoli.
The Court decides who is the culprit, not the Chief Minister. Why did Yogi Adityanath recommend that 38 cases against the 100 people charged in Muzaffarnagar riots will be withdrawn?
Has the Uttar Pradesh police completely failed to do its job? 
Why did the State fail to protect the key eyewitness in the Muzaffarnagar riots case?

snippet.title: Bengaluru Riots: Who tore the city's peaceful character apart? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Bengaluru riots were being discussed, the vengeful riot that took place in Bengaluru over a social media post and led to a mob violently attacking Congress MLA and a police station.

Aiyshwarya Mahadev, Congress Spokesperson states that the incident is deplorable, such sort of violence being resorted to, is something that deserves action and condemnation. 

Dr. Tasleem A Rehmani, National Secretary SDPI, and President, Muslim Political Council states that two members of the party were found linked to Bengaluru violence, and four members were accused of inciting violence at a protest in January.

Rajshekhara S, Political Editor, Bangalore Mirror, explains that whenever riots break out in Bengaluru, this area has been a hotspot for them, he adds, that BJP knows that it is a sensitive area, hence the  BJP government should have alerted and kept a better track at the situation.

snippet.title: Rhea Chakraborty granted bail; Are celebrities an easy target for witch hunt? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, as Rhea Chakraborty gets relief from Narcotics Control Bureau, it is stated that she was had not participated in the procurement of drugs. Many have now claimed witch-hunt pertaining to the different narratives that are now set in the Sushant Singh Rajput death case. AIIMS forensic report ruled out murder and foul play, whereas Sushant Singh Rajput's family lawyer has now asked for a fresh new probe in the case. Geeta Luthra, a senior advocate in the Supreme Court states that the question is, would the rule of law not be the same for everyone? She further adds that the Supreme Court itself has said that criminal cases of MLAs and MPs gave to have special benches.

KV Sridhar, Ad Guru, explains that it is up to individual celebrities to draw a line between what is legal and what is moral. He further adds that it is very difficult to not destroy yourself if you put a foot on the wrong side of the law. 

Nupur Mehta, an actor questions if it is concerning when the law-enforcement agencies believe that film actors need to be treated differently?

'To even have the conversation that because you’re a celebrity, we’re going to hold you to a different standard and you’ll have to pay more dearly than other people is ridiculous', says  Sucharita Tyagi, Film Critic.

snippet.title: Is denying MPs right to question the government, undemocratic? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Afrida Rahman Ali discusses a highly contentious issue of a decision that has been taken by the government with regards to the monsoon session of Parliament.  The Lok Sabha secretariat has made an official release for the schedule of the monsoon session and surprisingly, it does not have the question hour, due to the COVID-19 pandemic.  This decision has resulted in many disputes and political debates.

What is the question hour? Is denying MPs the right to question the government, undemocratic?

‘If COVID-19 is the reason then why have the session at all? If it is to prevent people from getting infected then what's the guarantee that they'll be at maximum danger during the question hour & rest of the day, they'll be fine’ says, Senior Journalist, Javed Mansari

While, RS MP CPI, Binoy Viswam says, ‘The government is angry with the questions. People are dying on the streets, this government has failed everywhere and they can't claim it has any concern for the poor’, Congress’ Spokesperson question, ‘The question hour is the soul of democracy. When the Parliament can run for 4 hours then why can't there be a question hour?

WATCH!

snippet.title: What the Hyderabad Poll results for the BJP signify? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, BJP leaders are seeing the Hyderabad election results as a ‘semi-final’ before the 2023 Assembly election, which will be the grand final in the party’s attempt to wrest away the state from the TRS. In the 2018 Assembly election, the BJP barely registered its presence, winning just one seat from the 118 it contested in the 119-member Assembly, with a vote percentage of just above 7 per cent. Is Hyderabad Polls a BJP's launchpad to Southern India? What does this mean for TRS (Telangana Rashtra Samithi) who has gripped the Telangana? Did the polarising campaign of BJP really work for them?

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, it's Tradition Vs Equality as the Supreme Court gave its judgement on the Sabrimala Temple case today.
Reading out a majority verdict, Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi said the question of whether women of all ages should be allowed into Sabarimala is part of a larger debate. Whether the Supreme Court should review its decision to end the ban on women between 10 and 50 entering Kerala's Sabarimala Temple will be taken up by a larger seven-judge bench.
A number of petitions were filed after the SC verdict in September last year sparked violent protests in Kerala. CJI remarked, "The endeavour of the petitioners was to revive debate on religion and faith."

This is about our fundamental right. We're coming forward for our right to equality & right to pray that has been given to us: Trupti Desai, Founder of Bhumata Brigade to Tanvi Shukla
#RightToPray
#SabarimalaCase #SabrimalaTemple

snippet.title: MLA's rewarded for abandoning Government; No deterrent for turncoat Netas? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,

Story 1 Karnataka Bypoll Election

The BJP top leadership has announced nominations for 13 of the 15 Karnataka Assembly seats set to face bypolls on December 5. And they all go to 13 disqualified MLAs who joined the party just hours before the tickets were announced on November 14.
The disqualified MLAs have changed parties, have gotten a ticket, will fight elections & hope to become MLAs again. That's not a deterrent at all. We need stronger laws because our politicians are greedy, power-hungry & thick-skinned and that needs to change now.
Kailash Vasdev, Senior SC Advocate says"The entire concept of the convention, to have a stable govt, to have democratic principles in Parliament or in the state assembly, to run a country in accordance with law is now forgotten."
Should the law be changed to punish turncoat Netas? Do we need a stronger deterrent?

Story 2 Is Law and Order a joke for U.P. Police?

After "Thain Thain", Cops gallop on batons.
Does this look like a good re-vamp of the police dept that is being done by the govt? Shouldn't they actually have access to horses, functional guns & proper training?

WATCH!

snippet.title: UP Govt files FIR for inciting caste violence in Hathras; Attempt to save face? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On this edition of The Urban Debate Weekend, we discuss the Hathras gangrape case and the Uttar Pradesh Government's decision to file an FIR for inciting caste-based violence against unnamed persons. This FIR also comes close to the decision of the Yogi Adityanath led the government's decision to call for a CBI inquiry.

If we go through the timeline of the investigation; we can see a hasty cremation of the victim, to begin with, opposition leaders like Rahul Gandhi & other leaders being heckled and blocked from Hathras and now this alleged attempt by the Uttar Pradesh government to save face. Is the probe on the right track? Is there any hope of justice to be served to the victim?

On the panel, we have Former DGP of Uttar Pradesh VN Rai, BJP Spokesperson Manish Shukla, Samajwadi Party Spokesperson Juhi Singh and Congress Spokesperson Aishwarya Mahadev to debate on the UP government's move in the Hathras gangrape horror.

snippet.title: India bids farewell to the martyrs, Will justice be brought to them? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, India bids adieu to the bravehearts who lost their lives fighting against the Chinese army. This incident has opened up a lot of debates about the policies of china and the central government’s work to safeguard the army from such violent incidents. 20 of our Bravehearts are no more. 20 of them who came from 11 states, spoke about 9 different languages but had one similarity, their unparalleled bravery. The stories of our Galwan Heroes are the ones that each one should know. India bows down to these heroes.

Each hero had a story, a family, a life and a home and all of that will miss them. Justice must be brought to them and policies should be framed so that no one has to go through this again. 


#GalwanHeroes

snippet.title: 50% people battle suicidal thoughts; Will India normalise Mental Health issues? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate’s special broadcast, Tanvi Shukla briefs you on a mental health awareness campaign ‘Act Now’ initiated by Times Network. To understand more about mental health and how do Urban Indians deal with it, your channel conducted a survey and the results of the survey might shock you.
Some of the key takeaways from the survey tell us that Career is an important source of stress and happiness; there is mental health awareness even in small towns; Stigma around mental health is prominent in affluent class; Over 55% Indians have gone through suicidal thoughts; While 28% term mental health issue as ‘gone mad’.
Will India normalise Mental Health illness?

snippet.title: Mumbai's wetlands destroyed, Why is Govt turning a blind eye? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
Greed puts Mumbai at risk; green cover in wetlands destroyed.
We think murder is only when someone physically kills somebody else. But No, murder also happens when you destroy the environment which will directly result in people dying!
One of the reasons for the 2005 Mumbai floods was MMRDA's bad handling of the BKC reclamation. Why can't we learn from those mistakes and stop being irresponsible?!
Why is the government turning a blind eye towards the destruction of Mumbai's wetlands?

#SaveOurMangroves

snippet.title: EC issues new COVID norms to conduct Bihar polls; Is it a free and fair choice? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, now that the Election Commission has released new COVID guidelines and Standard Operating Measures to conduct Bihar elections amidst the COVID pandemic, the new guidelines present special voting rules for COVID-19 patients. Tanvi Shukla takes you through the key highlights and the challenges for the Bihar polls.

Manoj Kumar Jha, MP from RJP questions that the party has been very skeptical about holding elections amid a pandemic, he questions the take on the guidelines that have been issued by the Election Commission for Bihar Elections. 

Ayishwarya M, Spokesperson from Congress says 'Why does Congress party believe that this will not lead to free and fair elections?' Shailesh Gandhi, Former CICI says that looking at what the Election Commission is proposing, he thinks that they have made a fairly decent effort to meet various issues that may come up. He further adds that there might be other issues but for that Election Commission must sit and discuss and people should cooperate.

snippet.title: Delhi riots: Is probe tilted towards one side of judgment along with lawyers? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, the new tug of war over the appointment of lawyers for the Delhi riots case has begun between Aam Aadmi Party and Delhi Police. Tanvi Shukla explains the entire matter. Delhi government is well within its right to appoint a panel of advocates and see to it that a fair trial is done, says Rani Srivastava. 

When looking at the sections pressed against the Muslims and the Hindus, we can see that the probe is tilting on one side, so it is right for the government to say that they should be allowed to pick lawyers, says Ananya Bhardwaj, Senior Assistant Editor, ThePrint India.

Anila Singh, BJP asks Arvind Kejriwal as to why he is not coming forward and telling what is wrong with Tushar Mehta, Amit Mahajan, and all the other lawyers provided to them. As per his statements, Rahul Mehta and the team will fight the court, Aam Aadmi Party's intention look mala fide.

snippet.title: Massive COVID surge in Mumbai's backyard, Kalyan-Dombivli new virus hotspots | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the lens is on Maharashtra, the worst affected state in the country but the conversation shifts to its neglected areas of Kalyan-Dombivli which have seen a massive surge in COVID cases. 

The regions have remained out of focus, while the attention has been fixed on Mumbai, however, Mirror Now investigates the deep connection between both areas and how the situation in Mumbai cannot improve without working to curb the spread in both. 

"If the number of COVID cases in Thane is coupled with that in Kalyan-Dombivli, it will become the third-largest urban cluster in Maharashtra, and one of the top ten clusters in the country," says, Dr. Abhay Shukla, National Co-convener, Jan Swasthya Abhiyan 

Amid the heavy rain lashing Mumbai, there have been several cases of urban infrastructure collapse bringing into question the efficacy of civic bodies and government in securing the safety of the people living in the vulnerable areas. 

Who is accountable for the insurmountable damage to life and property? 


#KalyanCovidCaseSurge #MumbaiBuildingCollapse

Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: BJP ruled states mulls for anti-conversion law; Are the existing laws failing? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla talks about the new controversy that has been sparked by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. U.P CM in a rally said that the state is going to introduce stricter laws to fight Love Jihad. Following U.P CM, other BJP ruled states have announced a similar action to that of Yogi Adityanath. Love Jihad is once again back into the narrative. 5 BJP ruled states have stated that they are mulling an anti-conversion law. Yogi Adityanath was backed by Haryana, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, and Assam. The leaders of all these states have used the term Love Jihad repeatedly. Tanvi Shukla explains how it all started and whether the existing laws are not enough?

To discuss the same, Tanvi Shukla takes with the panelists on the show. Fuad Halim CPI(M) leader states that the issue in itself is pathetic. He further adds that however, timing is vital as the Central government has failed to contain COVID-19 and has performed miserably in terms of the economy, rural unemployment, on the other hand, has increased.

Yogi Adityanath was backed by Haryana, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, and Assam. The leaders of all these states have used the term Love Jihad repeatedly. Tanvi Shukla explains how it all started and whether the existing laws are not enough?

To discuss the same, Tanvi Shukla takes with the panelists on the show. Fuad Halim CPI(M) leader states that the issue in itself is pathetic. He further adds that however, timing is vital as the Central government has failed to contain COVID-19 and has performed miserably in terms of the economy, rural unemployment, on the other hand, has increased.

snippet.title: Has Government weakened the laws of political funding? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about why the Government of India had brought some changes in the rules of political funding, these changes were made in the last two years.
Three fundamental changes were made by the Government.
The problem with the changes made is that the voter doesn't know who has given a political party the money. They don't know whose favours you'll be returning if you come to power. And as a voter, it's our democratic right to know who gave you money!
We appeal to the Supreme Court to intervene and ensure that as citizens of this country we've access to the information that tells us where's the money coming from!

snippet.title: Farms & factories face labour shortage, What is needed to bring workers back? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, there have been various incidents emerging of confrontation between the states and private hospitals. The idea of the debate was to resolve the existing policies for COVID hospitals to either make uniform policies for all. 

Dr. Raj B Singh, Pulmonologist, Apollo Hospital, Chennai said that in a country like India, 90% of healthcare should be provided from public funding because it is our underinvestment that has produced great shortages which are now being filled in by private medicines. 

Akshay Marathe from Aam Aadmi Party talks about how black marketing of beds has taken over the pandemic in our country. There should be proper checking of private hospitals in the country and a sustainable system should be built to tackle the illness.

Watch!

The question of whether the government should step in, and subsidize some part of the cost of private hospitals is still a concern for many.

snippet.title: Ballia murder case sparks controversy; Is the UP Police trying to shield accused? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the Ballia murder case. A man murdered in front of the SDM and other police officials, raises the question whether having political patronage allows you to kill someone?
A dispute for allocation of a ration shop got so ugly that it resulted in a man being murdered in the presence of top officials and yet there was no arrest made. 
After a massive rise in the number of cases in UP and the administration and officials being under constant scrutiny, it seems there is no law and order in the state. 
Sharat Pradhan, Senior Journalist, has commented on the government. He stated that the officials went out of their way to indirectly protect the accused and still claim their law and order is better than most states in the country. 
Samajwadi party’s Ghanshyam Tiwari has stated that the government has turned Uttar Pradesh into a lawless land. People sitting on the lap of criminals cannot construct ‘Ram Rajya’, he said. Instead they can constructs arguments of ‘Ram Rajya’, he continued. 

#BalliMurder #UPPolice

snippet.title: Shouldn’t citizens deserve better than political candidates with criminal cases? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the recent data released by ADR on the criminal background of the candidates contesting in the Bihar elections. 

Over a thousand political candidates were analysed by ADR and the numbers have been dispiriting. The number one party with the most number of criminal cases is RJD. 54% of their candidates, i.e. 22 candidates who were given tickets to contest in Phase 1 have criminal cases against them. LJP who has recently split with the NDA contests second with 49%, 20 candidates, having criminal cases. BJP witnesses 45% of their candidates having serious criminal cases. Congress, although has far fewer seats comparatively has not fallen behind with 43% of its candidates having criminal cases. Lastly, JDU has allotted 29% of its tickets to candidates have criminal cases. 

Jagdeep Chhokar, from ADR, speaks on the matter. He says that although the Supreme Court made it mandatory for political parties to upload on their websites the detailed information of candidates with pending criminal cases, only one party has followed the norm. 

Neerja Chowdhury, a Senior Journalist, says that political parties are a law unto themselves. “There is no political will to bring about a change… Unless the voters of India say enough is enough, nothing will change,” she says.

#CriminalNetasOfBihar #BiharElections2020

snippet.title: Will Indian political parties find a conclusion to farmers amidst the Kisan Dharna?|The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we discuss the 7th day of the farmer crisis where the deadlock continues even as the Kisan Andolan finds no conclusive points. The centre, yesterday, moved to resolve the standoff by inviting 32 farmer unions for talks but both parties failed to reach a consensus as the farmers fail to warm up to the government’s suggestion of forming a committee to look into their demands. There are massive traffic jams at the border areas of Delhi that have been reported. The farmers have now intensified their agitation and many farmers from Gwalior are now leaving for Delhi to join the protests against the centre’s farm laws. As per the farmers, they will spread the agitation across the country so their voices are heard. They also want a special session of the parliament pertaining to the farm laws. A stage has been set for detailed talks but there has been no conclusive response from both the parties. The heavy blockade in Delhi has resulted in multiple entry points being closed for people. All eyes are now set on the Kisan memorandum. The farmers want oppression to end and be addressed.

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla continues to discuss the COVID vaccine and the hunt that is now on for the vaccine. Ever since the COVID pandemic struck the country and the world, everyone has been pinning their hopes on the vaccine and have been desperately waiting for the vaccine. While the United Kingdom rolled out its vaccine Pfizer for mass immunization, people back home are still anxiously waiting for a vaccine. The focus as of now is on companies like Serum Institute and Bharat Biotech, who are now the front runners and have also applied for emergency use. Along with these two, Pfizer has also applied for emergency use authorization and is waiting for approval. However, the committee has asked for additional data from the applicants. 

Transparency is the key and the drug regulator has to come out and communicate, what exactly did they ask from these companies, says Divya Rajagopalan.

snippet.title: U.P Government's banner on Anti-CAA protesters highly unjust? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Allahabad High-Court orders U.P government to remove all posters put up by U.P Police  that named & shamed people accused of violence during Anti-CAA stir. Is it right to make accused's identity public? 

What Yogi Govt did in U.P wasn't wrong. There was no ill intention. It was only done to tell people that those  people on the hoardings were indulged in creating ruckus on rods during Anti-CAA Protests. says BJP's Anila Singh.

Tanvi Shukla to Kailash Vasdev Sr SC Advocate, U.P Govt says that if the people who have been named are upset, they can take it up with the Government. Why is the Court interfering?

#AntiCAAProtest

Watch!

snippet.title: Should the judiciary be more gender sensitized? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about gender sensitization because of a bizarre order that was given by the Madhya Pradesh court, in a case of molestation. The order came out in July 2020, but it is being discussed in detail again now because of the plea that was filed by a hoard of judges in the Supreme Court. The issue has also been raised today by the Attorney General of India KK Venugopal, who admits that there is a need for gender sensitization in our judicial system. This admission comes after some of the most bizarre and derogatory judgments from different courts in the country. 

Tanvi Shukla is joined by a group of advocates and judges, who explain what prompted them to take the matter to the Supreme Court? Aparna Bhat, a petitioner says that all kinds of comments have been made for women in these judgments. Justice Gyan Sudha Mishra is asked whether there are any gender sensitization programs, to which she says that there are, and they are still prevalent.

snippet.title: Has CM Gehlot failed to make the State safe for women? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza tonight, Lawlessness in Rajasthan exposed. Two rape horrors from Alwar. A Dalit couple was targeted, the husband thrashed and the woman gang-raped in front of him and this was just the beginning of their nightmare. The couple claimed the police refused to register an F.I.R in the case and asked them to wait for the elections to get over. The opposition party in the State the BJP has raised protests demanding a CBI probe in the case. As the Alwar case snowballed, the police were forced to act. The 6 men who were accused have been arrested. The Alwar gangrape case has completely exposed the law and order breakdown in Rajasthan. Have elections taken priority over law? Listen in!

snippet.title: Delhi School Boys on Police radar for online chat, Where are we going wrong? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Delhi schoolboys on police radar for their online chat objectifying girls, sharing morphed images & chats on gang-raping girls. And this isn't the first instance! Where are we going wrong? Is there a regulation aspect that needs to be brought in? 

We need to formulate a policy by training teachers, as to what role they can play. Teachers need to look beyond their role of just teaching in the classroom. says, Indian Association of Teachers Educators Regional Secretary West Prof. Sanjeev Sonawane.

The child should be made aware that once legal action is taken, his entire future is in jeopardy. That should be a part of education. The existence of laws should be explained. says,  Former Commissioner of Delhi Police Neeraj Kumar.

#BoisLockerRoom 

Watch!

snippet.title: India Vs Love ke Dushman: Should all States protect inter-faith couples? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, The Kerala government says it will give safe houses to inter-faith couples. Should all states protect inter-faith couples?  

What kind of protection is provided to the couples in these safe-homes? Tanvi Shukla questions Activist, Jagmati Sangwan. 

These killings are called 'honour killing', what's the honour in this? says, Sudha Ramalingam, Senior Advocate.

#KeralaSafeHouses
